metadata.query: top news stories from Kolkata today

articles.headline: Mobile apps to expand breast cancer outreach and care launched in Kolkata
articles.summary: The Institute of Breast Disease in Kolkata has introduced two mobile apps aimed at enhancing breast cancer awareness, early detection, and treatment adherence. The launch was officiated by state health and education officials. This marks a significant step in leveraging technology for public health.
articles.detailed_summary:
• Two new mobile applications launched by the Institute of Breast Disease (IBD)
• Apps designed to enhance awareness, early detection, and treatment adherence
• Launch event attended by Dr. Swapan Saren, Director of Health Services, West Bengal
• Principal Secretary (Education) Binod Kumar also present
• Initiative aims to reach a broader and more diverse population
articles.context: Institute of Breast Disease – a specialized medical institution in Kolkata dedicated to breast cancer research, diagnosis, and treatment, playing a key role in regional public health initiatives.

articles.headline: For 3rd time in Jan, North‑South Kolkata Metro ops hit due to tech snag
articles.summary: The North–South Blue Line of the Kolkata Metro experienced its third disruption in January due to technical issues, affecting services on January 22. The delay caused commuter inconvenience, with truncated operations until normalcy resumed.
articles.detailed_summary:
• Third major disruption in January, latest on January 22
• First train stalled at Rabindra Sadan, causing a 42-minute suspension between Maidan and Tollygunge
• Services operated on truncated stretches: Maidan–Dakshineswar and Mahanayak Uttam Kumar–Shahid Khudiram
• Normal operations resumed by 8:17 AM
• Previous disruptions on January 13 and January 5 due to power and technical failures
articles.context: Kolkata Metro North–South Line – the oldest metro line in India, serving as a vital urban transit artery in Kolkata, frequently affected by technical and infrastructure challenges.

articles.headline: Boy found dead in lift shaft
articles.summary: A tragic incident in Entally saw the body of a 3-year-old boy discovered in a water-filled open elevator shaft at a construction site. The child had been reported missing earlier, and the body was sent for examination.
articles.detailed_summary:
• Victim: 3-year-old boy named Pritam Rajbanshi
• Found in a water-filled open elevator shaft at an under-construction building in Entally
• Injury marks observed on the body
• Parents had reported him missing at Entally Police Station
• Body taken to NRS Hospital for further examination

articles.headline: 16‑hour Setu shutdown for repairs on Sun
articles.summary: Vidyasagar Setu will be closed for 16 hours on Sunday for essential repair work, including cable and bearing replacements. Traffic diversions will be in place, and further closures are expected during the bridge’s rehabilitation.
articles.detailed_summary:
• Closure scheduled from 5 AM to 9 PM on Sunday
• Maintenance includes replacement of stay and holding-down cables and bearings
• Part of broader rehabilitation of the 33-year-old bridge
• Managed by Hooghly River Bridge Commissioners (HRBC)
• Traffic diversions to be implemented by Kolkata Police
articles.context: Vidyasagar Setu – also known as the Second Hooghly Bridge, a major cable-stayed bridge in Kolkata connecting Howrah and Kolkata, critical for vehicular traffic and commerce.

articles.headline: R‑Day flyers told to reach airport early for checks
articles.summary: Ahead of Republic Day, Kolkata airport has intensified security, advising passengers to arrive early due to enhanced screening. Two layers of checks and additional personnel have increased waiting times.
articles.detailed_summary:
• Enhanced security for Republic Day travel
• Two layers of screening: at entrance and before boarding gates
• Additional personnel deployed at terminal entrances and screening areas
• Waiting times increased by 15–20 minutes
• Domestic passengers advised to arrive 3 hours early; international, 4 hours early
articles.context: Republic Day – India’s national day celebrated on January 26, marked by heightened security across transport hubs and public spaces.

articles.headline: Chingrighata night traffic block trial for Metro work starts
articles.summary: Traffic police have begun night-time trial diversions at Chingrighata to prepare for upcoming Metro construction. New slip roads and a traffic post have been introduced to manage flow during future weekend blocks.
articles.detailed_summary:
• Night traffic trials initiated at Chingrighata from Thursday
• Slip road created near Captain Bhery connecting flyover to Beliaghata Canal Road and EM Bypass
• Trials conducted in two slots: 8–11:30 AM and 5–8:30 PM
• New traffic post established at Majherpara, funded by Metro authorities
• Aimed at familiarizing motorists before February weekend night blocks
articles.context: Chingrighata – a major junction in Kolkata; Metro viaduct construction requires temporary traffic management to minimize disruption.

articles.headline: Gold Silver Price Today, 23 January, 2026: बाजार खुलते ही चांदी ₹12,600 उछली, सोने में 2800 की तेजी, जानें MCX गया रेट
articles.summary: On January 23, silver prices surged by ₹12,600 and gold by ₹2,800 per 10 grams. In Kolkata, 22-carat gold is priced at ₹14,737/g and 24-carat at ₹15,894/g.
articles.detailed_summary:
• Silver price jumped by ₹12,600 at market open
• Gold increased by ₹2,800 per 10 grams
• Kolkata rates: 22-carat gold at ₹14,737/g; 24-carat at ₹15,894/g
• Delhi: 22-carat ₹14,675/g; 24-carat ₹15,826/g
• Highest 24-carat rate in Ranchi at ₹16,040/g
articles.context: Gold and silver prices – key indicators in commodity markets, influenced by global trends and domestic demand; important for investors and jewelers.

articles.headline: From football to literature: Bonds that bind Argentina & West Bengal
articles.summary: The article explores cultural ties between Argentina and West Bengal, highlighting shared passions for football and literature. The Argentine Ambassador emphasizes mutual admiration for Tagore’s works and football culture.
articles.detailed_summary:
• Cultural connection spans 17,000 km between regions
• Shared passion for football, with fervent fan bases in both places
• Rabindranath Tagore’s literary works deeply respected in Argentina
• Argentine Ambassador Mariano A. Caucino underscores these bonds
• Highlights how sports and literature foster international ties
articles.context: Rabindranath Tagore – Nobel laureate poet from Bengal, whose works have global influence; football – a unifying cultural phenomenon in both regions.

articles.headline: ED chief likely to meet officers involved in I‑PAC searches
articles.summary: Enforcement Directorate Director Rahul Naveen arrived in Kolkata to review operations, including the January 8 I‑PAC office searches. He is expected to meet involved officers at the CGO Complex and assess security arrangements.
articles.detailed_summary:
• ED Director Rahul Naveen arrived Thursday night in Kolkata
• Visit follows January 8 searches at I‑PAC office and director’s residence
• He will meet officers at CGO Complex on Friday morning
• Meetings to assess working conditions and security for ED personnel
• Return flight likely Friday evening, though not confirmed
articles.context: Enforcement Directorate (ED) – India’s financial investigation agency, often involved in high-profile political and corporate probes; I‑PAC – political consultancy firm under investigation.
